Spectator Graphics visualized the number of undergraduate courses ending at each hour in GMT+8, the timezone local to Chinese, Singaporean, Malaysian and Filipino students who make up the majority of Columbia’s international student population.

8:00

137 classes

9:00

136 classes

10:00

48 classes

11:00

Out of the 3030 undergraduate classes during the Fall 2020 semester, only 7% ended between 9am and 5pm for those in GMT+8.

21:00

Columbia’s semesterly career fair, a chance for students to secure future jobs and internships, began at 10pm and ended at 3am. The Beyond Barnard Opportunities Fair went from 12am to 4pm.

“I was absolutely fried, my brain was not working. Like, I had video off, mute.”

1:00

The busiest hour occurs between 12am and 1am, during which 477 classes conclude.

Participation is difficult when “you're just trying to stay awake and take some notes.”

Social events such as Barnard’s Millie Meets often happened at 4am.
